subject: Public Speaking
title: Pope Francis on Climate and Poverty
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Pope Francis on Climate and Poverty.

hook.text: In 2015, Pope Francis addressed the U.S. Congress â€” the first pope ever to do so â€” and talked about the planet.

buildup.text: He linked climate change to poverty, arguing that environmental destruction hurts the poorest people the most.

discovery.text: His encyclical Laudato Si' had already framed ecology as a moral issue. The speech made it a political one.

twist.text: Some lawmakers squirmed. A religious leader was challenging their economic policies using their own moral language.

climax.text: Francis showed that moral authority from outside politics can sometimes do what politicians themselves cannot.

punchline.text: He spoke as a priest. Congress heard a prophet.

quiz.question: What connection did Pope Francis draw in his Congress speech?
